assets.title: Copilot Vision
assets.description: See and browse the world with your AI companion and get advice and insights on what you’re seeing.
assets.content:
_Copilot Vision is currently available in the United States (with the exception of Illinois and Texas), and is rolling out to more markets soon._

# Reimagine how you see and browse with Copilot Vision’s help.

Copilot Vision is a new way to share your experience with AI and get help in real-time. It’s like having a second set of eyes that will instantly scan, analyze, and offer insights based on what Copilot sees on your screen or through your mobile camera. When you tap into Copilot Vision, Copilot can talk about what you see.

![|poster=https://copilot.microsoft.com/static/copilotlabs/copilot-vision-video-1-cover.jpg](https://copilot.microsoft.com/static/copilotlabs/copilot-vision-video-1.mp4)

![|poster=https://copilot.microsoft.com/static/copilotlabs/copilot-vision-video-2-cover.webp](https://copilot.microsoft.com/static/copilotlabs/copilot-vision-video-2.mp4)



# Frequently Asked Questions

## Who has access to Copilot Vision?

We have expanded Copilot Vision across Edge, iOS, Android and the Windows app. Free users 18 years or older who are signed into Copilot with a Microsoft account can now try Copilot Vision across Edge, iOS, Android and the Windows app while Copilot Pro subscribers will enjoy higher usage limits. Copilot Vision is currently available in the United States (with the exception of Illinois and Texas), and is rolling out to more markets soon.

## How can I access Copilot Vision in Edge?

Open Edge browser on your desktop. Make sure you’re signed in to your personal Microsoft account. In your Edge browser window, tap the Copilot icon in the top right corner to open Copilot in the sidepane. Then tap the mic icon at the bottom of the sidepane to begin a session with Vision. The Copilot composer will show a glasses icon indicating that Vision is now active. Please note there is no longer a bottom entry point for Vision from your Edge browser.

## How can I access Copilot Vision in my Android or iOS app?

Make sure you’re signed in to your personal Microsoft account. From your Android or iOS device, Copilot Vision can be accessed within Voice mode of the Copilot app. When you begin a voice conversation with Copilot, the glasses icon will appear for you to begin Copilot Vision.

## How can I access Copilot Vision on Windows?

Copilot Vision can be accessed from the composer in the Copilot on Windows app. Click on the Vision glasses icon to select an open app window to share with Copilot Vision. After you share an open app window, you can ask Copilot about content in the app or ask "show me how" to complete a task using the highlights feature.

Will Copilot Vision eventually roll out to all Copilot customers?

We’re taking our time to garner feedback, iterate on the technology, and will expand access to more Copilot endpoints soon.

## Is Copilot Vision always on? Is it always looking at what’s on my Edge browser window, desktop screen or mobile camera feed?

No, Copilot Vision is not always on. Vision will only be active when you initiate a Vision session. When a Vision session is ongoing, the Copilot composer will have a Vision glasses icon indicating that you are in an active Vision session. The session will end if you end it in the composer, close the Copilot app, close the window shared, or remain inactive for an extended period. To use Vision again, click on the glasses icon in the Composer to start another session.

## Does Copilot Vision store or log any user inputs?

Copilot’s model responses are being logged to enable monitoring of unsafe interactions and outputs. User images, voice audio, and context will not be logged or stored. Your voice conversation with Vision is transcribed as part of your conversation history. You may delete the chat history at any time.

## Is Copilot Vision capturing and storing images of what I’m looking at?

No. No images or context are retained, transcribed, or logged. Once the session ends, all such data is deleted.

## What happens to the images I share with Copilot?

Whether you use Copilot Vision or upload an image, Copilot helps safeguard your data and protect your privacy. Images you upload or capture with Vision are processed only to respond to your request—they aren’t used to train AI models or personalize your experience. Screenshots and camera images shared with Vision aren’t stored after your session ends.

If you share an image in chat or use it for image generation or editing, it’s processed to complete your request and may be retained for up to 30 days, or until you delete it—whichever comes first.

Text transcripts of your interactions may be saved so you can revisit them later and to help monitor for abuse. These transcripts aren’t used for personalization, and you can delete them at any time.

Copilot clearly shows when Vision is active, and you’re always in control. You can delete uploaded images or your activity history through your Microsoft account settings.

## How does Copilot handle images of people?

Copilot may ask for your permission to process biometric data—like faces or hands—when you use features such as Copilot Vision or image upload. Consent for biometric processing applies anytime you upload or capture an image or video while using Copilot. This includes through your use of Copilot Vision, and image generation and editing tools. You only need to give consent once, and it applies across all Copilot experiences that involve image or video input and capture.

Biometric data is only processed if you upload or capture it, and it’s used solely to respond to your request. For example, if you snap a selfie and ask Copilot for help choosing a new hairstyle, or learning how to whistle, it may analyze your facial features to help craft a response.

You’re always in control of what you share. If you prefer not to have biometric data processed, simply avoid using these features. Do not share images of others without their consent.

## When using Copilot Vision, are you using website’s data that’s being viewed for training purposes?

No, we are not capturing, storing, or using any data to train our models. Once the Copilot Vision session ends all images, audio, and context are deleted. Model responses are stored to enable monitoring of unsafe interactions. A transcript of your conversation is stored in your history to enhance Copilot’s memory and is not used for training or personalization. You may delete the chat history at any time.

## Can I opt out of this new experience?

Yes. If you would like to revert to the previous Copilot experience on Edge without Copilot Vision, you can do so in your Edge Settings. Go to the Copilot and sidebar tab and toggle off “Allow Copilot Vision to view your webpage”

Copilot Vision in Mobile is an opt in feature within the voice mode.

Copilot Vision on Windows is an opt in feature from the glasses icon in the Copilot composer.

## Does this feature turn off when you go to the next web page or when you start using another app?

No, Vision remains on until you end the session by closing the Edge window or shared app or exiting from the experience in the Copilot Composer. It can only see the window that you’ve shared. You can check whether Vision is on by looking for the glasses icon in the Composer.

## Does Copilot Vision work with any website or app?

Copilot Vision works with most websites. It does not work on some sites, and it is blocked on those containing harmful or adult content. When you visit a site that is not currently enabled, the Copilot Composer will show a crossed eye, and the model will refuse to discuss the content. For more information, see our [Terms of Use](https://www.bing.com/new/termsofuse).

Yes, Copilot Vision works with any app on Windows. However, if the content includes harmful or DRM-protected material, Copilot will not be able to analyze it.

## Will Copilot Vision take control of my browser or perform actions on my behalf?

Copilot Vision does not engage directly with the web on your behalf; it’s there to answer questions rather than take actions. Copilot may highlight content on the page to help you find the relevant information. It will not click, enter text, or scroll on your behalf.

## What prevents Copilot Vision from being used for harmful, offensive, or illegal purposes?

Security and digital safety are top priorities for Microsoft. Copilot Vision is not accessible on offensive and harmful sites, and cannot be used for harmful, offensive, or illegal topics. Learn more at [Empowering Responsible AI practices](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/ai/responsible-ai).

## Can Copilot Vision be used in commercial/enterprise environments?

At this time, Vision is only part of the consumer Copilot offering. You must be signed in with a personal Microsoft account to use these features.

## How is Copilot Vision different than Recall?

Copilot Vision and Recall are different features with different goals.

Vision works strictly in the context of what you choose to share during the session. Screenshots, audio, and context are not stored. Only your conversation transcript is saved, and you can delete it anytime.

Recall is supported only on [Copilot+ PCs](https://www.microsoft.com/windows/copilot-plus-pcs?r=1#faq2). For users who opt in, Recall takes encrypted snapshots of the screen and stores them locally. Learn more at [Privacy and control over your Recall experience](https://support.microsoft.com/windows/privacy-and-control-over-your-recall-experience-d404f672-7647-41e5-886c-a3c59680af15).

assets.title: Copilot Gaming Experiences
assets.description: A research demo at the intersection of gaming and AI.
assets.content:
_Copilot Gaming Experiences is currently available in English on copilot.microsoft.com for users over the age of 18._

# Experience AI-driven interactions that can create new ways to play.

Welcome to an experimental, AI-powered gameplay experience hosted in Copilot Labs. Powered by the Muse World and Human Action Model (WHAM) built by Microsoft Research, this tech demo offers an early look at how generative AI can simulate interactive gameplay.

Copilot Gaming Experiences represents a practical step forward in exploring how AI can create brand new ways to interact with games while building upon existing ones. By generating gameplay in real time, the underlying Muse shows how classic games like Quake II can be reimagined through modern AI techniques.

![](https://copilot.microsoft.com/static/copilotlabs/copilot-gaming-image-1.jpg)

In this real-time tech demo, Copilot dynamically generates gameplay sequences inspired by the classic game Quake II. Every input you make triggers the next AI-generated moment in the game, almost as if you were playing the original Quake II running on a traditional game engine. Enjoy the experience, share your thoughts, and help shape the future of AI-powered gameplay experiences.

Note: Each demo session has a time limit at this time.



# Frequently Asked Questions

## What is Copilot Gaming Experiences?

Copilot Gaming Experiences is an experimental, AI-powered gaming experience that brings cutting-edge research to life within Copilot Labs. Built on the innovative World and Human Action Model (WHAM) technology from Microsoft Research, Copilot Gaming Experiences dynamically generates game visuals and responds to player inputs in real time, simulating interactive gameplay without relying on traditional game engines. Designed as a short, one-minute tech demo, it offers players a glimpse into next-generation AI gaming experiences.

## What is WHAM? How does it work?

Copilot Gaming Experiences is a World and Human Action Model (WHAM), our groundbreaking generative AI model that can dynamically create gameplay visuals and simulate player behavior in real time. Its development by Microsoft Research, recently published in the scientific journal Nature, marks a significant step forward in our ability to merge research with real-world product innovation.

## What is the experience in Copilot Labs?

This bite-sized demo pulls you into an interactive space inspired by Quake II, where AI crafts immersive visuals and responsive action on the fly. It’s a groundbreaking glimpse at a brand new way of interacting with games, turning cutting-edge research into a quick and compelling playable demo.

## What games are available in the initial experience in Copilot Labs?

The initial experience on Copilot Labs is powered by a Copilot Gaming Experiences model trained on gameplay from Quake II.

## How do I access this demo?

The experience is accessible through a dedicated webpage on Copilot Labs. It’s designed for desktop use only, as the demo relies on keyboard controls and inputs.

## Is the experience available on mobile devices?

Currently, no. The experimental tech demo is optimized for desktop browsers because the experience requires a physical keyboard for effective control.

## How do I control the game?

The game is controlled via keyboard input.

- **Movement**: Use **WASD** to move (simulating a left stick).
- **Looking Around**: Use the **Arrow Keys** to adjust your view (simulating a right stick).
- **Jump**: Hit **Space**
- **Crouch**: Hit **C**
- **Fire**: Hit **F**

## Will this tech demo be available for commercial or enterprise use?

The tech demo on Copilot Labs is for consumers to try Copilot Gaming Experiences. However, the underlying Copilot Gaming Experiences research model is available for developers to try at Azure Foundry.

assets.title: Copilot Actions
assets.description: A new way for your AI companion to take action on your behalf on Windows and on the web.
assets.content:
_Copilot Actions is currently available to signed in Copilot users worldwide, except in the European Economic Area (EEA), Brazil, Canada, South Korea, Switzerland, United Kingdom, and Vietnam. Learn more about Actions in Edge [here](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2337628)._

# On the web

Let Copilot lend you a hand with web tasks. Copilot can now partner with you to complete tasks behind the scenes. Use simple chat prompts to ask Copilot to handle web tasks, from booking tickets, grabbing dinner reservations, or sending a thoughtful gift you can now ask Copilot to help cross it off your list.

After initiating a task you’ll have the ability to pause, stop, take control, and modify your request. Copilot Actions works with most websites, so test it out and let us know what you think.

# On your Windows PC

Copilot Actions can do the heavy lifting for you as a general purpose agent— simply describe the task you want to complete in your own words, and the agent will attempt to complete it by interacting with desktop and web applications. Whether you need a hand resizing or de-duplicating your recent vacation photos or need to extract info from a PDF or fill out repetitive forms, Copilot Actions can help.

Copilot Actions is operating in the background, in its own Desktop. Actions are in preview and may make mistakes, please monitor their work closely. At any time, you can take over the task or check in on the progress of the action, including reviewing what actions have been taken.

![](https://copilot.microsoft.com/static/copilotlabs/copilot-actions-video-2.mp4)

_Disclaimer: Copilot Actions is an early-stage AI-powered tool. It is available today as an experiment for Copilot users in Copilot Labs. While Copilot Actions has strong, built-in mitigations, it is not immune to web exploits and other security risks. Please monitor its activity closely, especially when tasks involve signing into a website or personal information, such as mailing addresses, email addresses, payment details, or other sensitive tasks._



# Frequently Asked Questions

## Example Starting Prompts

Here are some example prompts you can use to get started with Copilot Actions. The more detailed you are in your prompt the better. Imagine you were asking a friend to do a task on your behalf, they might want to know things like your preferences, the number of people, the dates, times, etc. to ensure they did a good job.

On the web

- [Order me a bouquet of flowers using **1800Flowers.com**](/?chat-mode=ac&prompt= "Order me a bouquet of flowers using 1800Flowers.com")
- [Book me a stay using **Booking.com**](/?chat-mode=ac&prompt= "Book me a stay using Booking.com")
- [Book me a travel package using **Expedia.com**](/?chat-mode=ac&prompt= "Book me a travel package using Expedia.com")
- [Reserve me a hotel room using **Hotels.com**](/?chat-mode=ac&prompt= "Reserve me a hotel room using Hotels.com")
- [Book me a car rental using **Kayak.com**](/?chat-mode=ac&prompt= "Book me a car rental using Kayak.com")
- [Make me a dinner reservation using **OpenTable.com**](/?chat-mode=ac&prompt= "Make me a dinner reservation using OpenTable.com")
- [Book me a cruise using **Priceline.com**](/?chat-mode=ac&prompt= "Book me a cruise using Priceline.com")
- [Find me a cheap flight using **Skyscanner.com**](/?chat-mode=ac&prompt= "Find me a cheap flight using Skyscanner.com")
- [Find me the highest rated restaurants using **Tripadvisor.com**](/?chat-mode=ac&prompt= "Find me the highest rated restaurants using Tripadvisor.com")
- [Book me a vacation rental on **VRBO.com**](/?chat-mode=ac&prompt= "Book me a vacation rental on VRBO.com")
- [Schedule me a tour using **Viator.com**](/?chat-mode=ac&prompt= "Schedule me a tour using Viator.com")


On your Windows PC

- Resize all photos in this vacation folder to 1080p
- Fill out the form at <www address> using the details in the attached pdf
- Rename all files in this folder to include today’s date
- Split this large video into two smaller clips

## What is Copilot Actions?

Copilot Actions is a new AI feature available in Copilot Labs. Copilot Actions is a new way for Copilot to be your companion by completing tasks on your behalf. Using a simple, conversational prompt as input, you can instruct Copilot to perform typical actions on the web — like searching for a venue or event, filling out a form, reserving a table in a restaurant, finding or booking travel, and so much more.

On Windows, Copilot Actions operates in an agent environment on your PC that’s isolated from your main session. It can access the web and interact with desktop apps installed on your PC, and—with your permission—work with your files. This allows Copilot Actions to complete tasks that combine web actions with local applications and file handling.

Please monitor its activity closely, especially when tasks involve signing into a website or personal information, such as mailing addresses, email addresses or payment details.

## How do Copilot Actions work?

Copilot does this by operating in the same way that a person would: via mouse clicks, scrolling, and typing.

On the web, Copilot does this in its own browser. On your Windows PC, Copilot operates in an agent environment on your PC that’s isolated from your main session.

When a task requires your attention, for example when your personal info or payment details are needed, Copilot will ask you for your input or for you to take control of the remote browser.

## Who has access to Copilot Actions?

Copilot Actions is currently available to signed in Copilot users, existing Copilot Pro subscribers, and Microsft 365 Premium subscribers users worldwide, except in the European Economic Area (EEA), Brazil, Canada, South Korea, Switzerland, United Kingdom, and Vietnam. Users must be signed in with their personal Microsoft Account.

Additionally, on Windows, Copilot Actions is only availble to users who are participating in the Windows Insider Program.

During this testing period, we will collect feedback to improve our product. We hope to expand access to Copilot Actions to more customers in the future.

## How can I use Copilot Actions?

On the web: To use Copilot Actions, use any modern browser on a desktop computer to navigate to Copilot.com.

On your Windows PC: Ensure you are enrolled in the Windows Insider Program and have the latest updates.

Users that have access to the new feature will be able to invoke Copilot Actions by selecting “Action” in the response options drop-down in the Chat Mode Menu in “Message Copilot” text box.

## Is Copilot Actions capturing and storing images of what it is looking at?

Yes. When running Actions, Copilot takes screenshots of the pages, applications, and documents it opens and uses them to inform the next step. These screenshots are linked to and retained with the conversation in your conversation history, giving you an opportunity to check Copilot’s work. When you delete a conversation, the screenshots are deleted with it. Otherwise, screenshots are retained for up to 30 days.

## Does Copilot Actions store or log user inputs, screenshots, and outputs?

As part of Copilot Actions, your text prompts are stored in your conversation history. Any information you input into the remote browser or Windows environment, for example personal data entered into a form, is not stored by Copilot. When you take control of the remote browser or isolated environment using the Take Control option, no screenshots are generated nor sent to Copilot until you hand back control to Copilot. Copilot Actions model responses are being monitored for unsafe interactions and outputs.

## Does Copilot have access to my passwords or personal information?

On the web: Copilot Actions on the web does not have access to your passwords or personal information saved on your local browser. When completing an Action on the web, Copilot is opening its own instance of Edge in a virtual machine.

On your Windows PC: Copilot Actions runs in an agent environment that is separate from your main Windows session. It does not have access to your saved passwords or app data. For files, it can work with content in your known folders (like Documents, Pictures, and Downloads) and files that are readable by all users on the device. It does not have unrestricted access to your entire system.

## When will Copilot Actions ask for confirmation, supervision, or for the user to take control?

At this time, Copilot will not make important decisions on its own and will ask for your attention and supervision for certain actions such as buying an item, booking a reservation, sending an email, or deleting an event from a calendar. For certain websites or sensitive tasks, it will ask you to take control of the remote browser entirely.

## How can I stop Copilot Actions from running

You can stop Copilot Actions from continuing a running task by clicking the pause button (with an option to resume) it or use the cancel button to completely cancel the task.

## Does Copilot Actions work with every site or app

On the web, Copilot Actions can interact with most publicly available sites on the web. Sites that don’t align to Copilot’s policies, such as sites containing offensive content, will not be accessible.

On your Windows PC, Copilot Actions can work with applications installed for all users—typically including the default apps that came with your device. However, performance may vary across different apps, and some tasks may not execute as smoothly as others.”

For more information on policy see [Terms of Use and Content Policy](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-copilot/for-individuals/termsofuse).

## What are some real-world use cases for Actions?

Copilot Actions can complete a variety of tasks, like booking a reservation or appointment, ordering groceries, or sending gifts to friends. Actions work across the web so it can complete a wide range of tasks based on your prompt.

On Windows, Actions can additionally work with desktop applications, files and folders, allowing it to complete repetitive tasks on multiple files in a folder, or tasks where multiple applications are required.

## Can Copilot Actions be used in commercial/enterprise environments?

Copilot Actions in Copilot Labs is part of the consumer Copilot offering. You are required to sign in with your personal Microsoft account to use this Copilot feature.

## Are there usage limits for Copilot Actions?

Yes, there is a limit to how many Copilot Actions you can perform. Copilot will let you know when a limit is reached and will explain the next steps.

## What prevents Copilot Actions from being used for harmful, offensive, or illegal purposes?

Security, digital safety, and responsible AI are top priorities for Microsoft. Copilot Actions will not be available to work with sites or content that Copilot has determined to contain harmful content or content not aligned with policies. Copilot Actions may not be used for harmful, offensive, or illegal activity. Copilot will refuse these tasks. Serious or repeated violations of the Code of Conduct may result in your suspension from using Copilot Actions.

To learn more visit [Transparency Note for Microsoft Copilot](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/transparency-note-for-microsoft-copilot-c1541cad-8bb4-410a-954c-07225892dbc2), [Responsible AI at Microsoft](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/ai/responsible-ai?ef_id=_k_c4227416d434108f727d1328f8e81f67_k_&OCID=AIDcmm1o1fzy5i_SEM__k_c4227416d434108f727d1328f8e81f67_k_&msclkid=c4227416d434108f727d1328f8e81f67#tools) and [Terms of Use and Content Policy](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-copilot/for-individuals/termsofuse).

assets.title: Mico
assets.description: A vibrant new way to talk with Copilot
assets.content:
_Mico is currently available to users in the U.S. If you aren't located in the U.S., join our [Discord Channel](http://discord.gg/go-copilot) to sign up for our Early Access program._

Mico makes voice conversations feel more natural and adaptive through animated expressions.

![Four pastel cartoon blob characters with different shapes and expressions: smiling, content, joyful heart-shaped, and surprised|shadow=0,w=422](https://copilot.microsoft.com/static/copilotlabs/copilot-appearance-image-1--2.png "Four pastel cartoon blob characters with different shapes and expressions: smiling, content, joyful heart-shaped, and surprised")

Mico brings a new dimension to your Copilot voice conversations through visual expressions and real-time animations. Powered by Copilot, Mico responds to your questions with both intelligent answers and animated reactions that match the moment. You can even personalize Mico's colors with simple voice commands or a button click to make it feel uniquely yours.

Mico can support you in everyday moments when you need:

- A practice partner: Rehearse important conversations, practice language skills, or prepare for challenging situations in a supportive, judgment-free environment
- A listener: Talk through whatever you're dealing with and share what's really on your mind, whether you're feeling up or down
- Creative collaboration: Explore new ideas and push your thinking further with an enthusiastic partner who encourages your creativity
- Decision support: Navigate important decisions by talking through possibilities and organizing your thoughts out loud

# How it works

**On Desktop ([copilot.microsoft.com](https://copilot.microsoft.com/)) and Mobile Apps (iOS and Android)**:

1. Tap the microphone icon to enter Voice mode
2. Tap the gear icon to open Voice settings
3. Toggle on the "Show Mico" setting
4. Ask a question or simply say "hi!" and see Mico react and speak back with smiles, nods, and other expressions.

Once enabled, you may see Mico on your home screen for easy access. You can turn off Mico anytime in Voice settings.

**Note**: If you don't see the settings toggle, you're not yet eligible to try this feature. Check back soon or join our [Discord Channel](http://discord.gg/go-copilot) to sign up for our Early Access program.



# Frequently Asked Questions

## What is Mico?

Mico makes your voice conversations more natural, engaging, and supportive through animated expressions that adapt to your conversation's tone and flow. Enjoy helpful answers paired with visual feedback for a more intuitive way to talk with AI.

## How can I access Mico?

You can access Mico by entering Voice mode on [copilot.microsoft.com](https://copilot.microsoft.com/) or in the Copilot mobile apps (iOS/Android), opening Voice settings, and toggling on "Show Mico". Once enabled, you can start a voice conversation and see Copilot respond with real-time expressions. Currently, Mico is available to users in the U.S. across web, iOS, and Android platforms.

## How can I turn this off?

You can turn off Mico at any time by going to Voice settings and toggling off the "Show Mico" option. This setting is available on both web and mobile versions.

## Can I customize how Copilot looks?

Yes! You can personalize Mico's color palette. Simply use voice commands like "turn forest green" or "change into a color inspired by the ocean waves" to instantly transform how Mico looks. You can also use the "change color" button on the top-right of the screen to shuffle through color palettes.

## Is Mico available in Enterprise or M365 Copilot plans?

At this time, this experience is only part of the consumer Copilot offering available at [copilot.microsoft.com](https://copilot.microsoft.com/) and in the consumer mobile apps.

## What features are still in the works?

While we cannot share specific details on the roadmap at this time, we welcome your feedback and ideas in our [Discord community](https://discord.com/invite/go-copilot).

assets.title: Copilot 3D
assets.description: Turn images into 3D models with one click.
assets.content:
_Copilot 3D is currently available for a subset of users._

# Copilot 3D transforms an image into a usable 3D model – ready to render, print, or incorporate.

Curious minds shouldn’t be held back by complex tools. Copilot 3D makes 3D creation more accessible. With just a single image anyone can start shaping ideas into three dimensions. No steep learning curve. No intimidating software. Just a new way to bring imagination to life.
Whether you're experimenting, teaching, or testing out something new, Copilot 3D makes it easy to get started.

# What will you discover with Copilot 3D?

- Transform your images into stunning 3D models instantly
- Integrate seamlessly with games, animation, 3D printing, design, VR/AR, digital content, art projects, and more
- Access a curated inspiration library featuring distinct scenes, designed to help you spark ideas and bring them to life faster

![](https://copilot.microsoft.com/static/copilotlabs/copilot-3d-video-1.mp4)

# See what’s possible with Copilot 3D

![](https://copilot.microsoft.com/static/copilotlabs/copilot-3d-video-2.mp4)



# Frequently Asked Questions

## What is Copilot 3D?

Copilot 3D is an AI-powered tool exclusive to Copilot Labs that lets users turn a single image into a fully rendered 3D model—no prior experience needed. It’s designed to make 3D creation fast, accessible, and intuitive.

Whether you're exploring ideas, testing a concept, or guiding hands-on learning, Copilot 3D supports imaginative experimentation without the complexity of traditional 3D software.

## Who has access to Copilot 3D?

While a paid subscription is not required, users must be signed in with their personal Microsoft Account to access this feature. Copilot 3D is available to users globally.

To use Copilot 3D, navigate to [Copilot.com](https://copilot.com) on any modern browser. At this time it is recommended to use on a desktop computer, but is accessible via mobile browsers.

## Does Copilot 3D support text-to-3D generation?

At this time, Copilot 3D supports only 2D image-to-3D image generation.

## Which file formats are available for download?

Copilot 3D currently supports downloads in GLB format, which is widely compatible with 3D viewers, design tools, and game engines.

## Will my generated 3D models be saved?

Yes—your creations are saved to your My Creations page for 28 days. After that, they’re automatically removed from our system. You can also delete them manually at any time.

## How are my uploaded images used?

Uploaded images are used by Copilot to generate your 3D models and process your request. At this time, Microsoft does not use uploaded images for training or personalization.

## What types of images can be uploaded to Copilot 3D?

Copilot 3D supports PNG or JPG files under 10MB.

Additionally, only upload content you have permission to use. Copilot 3D creations must follow our [Code of Conduct](https://www.bing.com/new/termsofuse) and avoid infringing on copyrighted material.

Keep in mind - all images you upload should be original images that you own or have the rights to use. Do not upload images that infringe third-party rights (including copyright, trademark, or publicity rights), violate the privacy of others, include depictions of individuals without consent, or otherwise violates the [Microsoft Services Agreement](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/servicesagreement?msockid=0d155ac0407264171ee04ff1418265be) and [Copilot Code of Conduct](https://www.bing.com/new/termsofuse).

You are solely responsible for the images you upload. Your account or Copilot usage may be restricted or suspended if we detect an attempt to upload illegal content or content that violates the Copilot Code of Conduct.

assets.title: Copilot Audio Expressions
assets.description: An experimental tool designed for effortless audio creation using Copilot's latest voice generation models.
assets.content:
_Copilot Audio Expressions is available in English. We're exploring ways to support more languages over time._

# Generate speech in seconds with Copilot Audio Expressions

Copilot Audio Expressions is a Copilot Labs experiment that transforms written text into natural, spoken narration—complete with emotion, personality, and style. You can adjust how the voice sounds to match your prompt, whether it calls for a gentle tone for a bedtime story, an upbeat message for a motivational pep talk, or theatrical flair for an epic adventure. Easily download audio samples to use for content creation.

It also includes **Story Mode**, which weaves together multiple vocal styles to generate engaging, accessible storytelling experiences—perfect for parents, educators, etc. Audio Expressions offers a glimpse into how AI can make audio content more immersive, expressive, and fun for everyone.

![](https://copilot.microsoft.com/static/copilotlabs/audio-expression-image-2.png)

# Available Features

In Copilot Audio Expressions, you can experiment with voice settings to explore different styles of narration:

- Using **Emotive Mode**, provide a script outline (prompt) and have Copilot perform it in a variety of styles.
  - Adjust the narrator’s tone and pace—from a calming whisper to an excited cheer—to match the mood of each scene.
  - Assign a distinct voice so your dialogue feels dynamic and alive.
- Try **Story Mode** to hear your own stories brought to life with expressive narration **and vivid imagery**.
- Use **Scripted Mode** for fast, direct conversion of your script into audio using TTS.
- Download audio samples to use in your personal projects



# Frequently Asked Questions

## Who can use Copilot Audio Expressions?

Copilot Audio Expressions is free to use. It’s available globally and works on any modern browser. Currently, this experimental tool supports English only. For the best experience, we recommend using a desktop computer, though it’s also accessible via mobile browsers.

## What’s the difference between Emotive Mode and Story Mode?

- **Emotive Mode** – You provide your own script outline as a prompt, choose a specific voice character and style, and Copilot enhances it for optimal listening.
- **Story Mode** – You share a story idea or short prompt, and Copilot crafts a custom script, selects the most fitting voice character, and brings your story to life **together with a matching cover image**.
- **Scripted Mode** - You provide a full script and Copilot reads it out directly. Ideal for quick previews or production-ready narration.

## How many audio expressions can I generate and download?

There's no set limit, however this may change based on the demand. Each expression varies in length - for a given prompt, the tool typically generates about 30 seconds (Emotive Mode) to about 90 seconds (Story Mode) of speech.

## What file format will my audio download in?

All audio expressions are provided in high-quality MP3 format, ready for sharing, embedding, or playback across devices.

## Is there any guidance on what I can use Copilot Audio Expressions for?

Copilot Audio Expressions is intended for personal use that aligns with the Copilot Code of Conduct.

Keep in mind — you should only input content you own or have the rights to use. Do not input copy or request audio that infringes on the rights of others (including copyright, trademark, or publicity rights), violates the privacy of others, or otherwise violates the [Microsoft Services Agreement](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/servicesagreement?msockid=0d155ac0407264171ee04ff1418265be) or [Copilot Terms](https://www.bing.com/new/termsofuse).

Your account or Copilot access may be restricted or suspended if we detect an attempt to input or generate illegal content or content that violates the [Copilot Terms Code of Conduct](https://www.bing.com/new/termsofuse).

assets.description: Voice chats just got more fun with Portraits!
assets.content:
_Copilot Portraits is rolling out gradually as an experiment in Copilot Labs. We're starting with a limited group of users in the United States, United Kingdom, and Canada to gather feedback and ensure a high-quality experience before expanding access._

# An immersive experiment built for practicing real-world conversations through voice and visuals.

Experience a new dimension of AI interaction with Copilot Portraits. This experiment transforms voice conversations by adding animated visual feedback. Choose from 40 unique portrait styles and watch as they respond with synchronized expressions as you talk.

Perfect for creative brainstorming, interview practice, and learning sessions, Portraits makes AI conversations more engaging and immersive with real-time visuals. Each portrait is intentionally stylized and not photorealistic, offering you visual variety while maintaining the same trusted Copilot intelligence and safety features you rely on.

# How it works

- **Explore & Choose**: Discover 40 unique animated portraits and pick the vibe that works for you.
- **Make it Yours**: Choose a voice you like or simply stick with the preset option.
- **Get Chatting**: Start speaking and see your portrait respond back with visual feedback.
- **Practice & Learn**: Perfect for practicing real-world scenarios, public speaking, interview prep, collaborative brainstorming, and learning something new.

# Safety Measures

Copilot Portraits prioritizes responsible AI innovation through multiple safeguards. This experiment features 40 pre-selected, stylized portraits that are intentionally non-photorealistic to maintain clear distinction from real people. All conversations are powered by Copilot's established safety infrastructure and content filters.

To encourage healthy usage, we have implemented time limits per session and per day. Available only to users 18+ in select markets to start, this Labs experiment includes persistent AI disclosures and clear labeling that you're interacting with AI technology.



# Frequently Asked Questions

## How can I try this experiment?

Try Copilot Portraits within Copilot Labs on your browser [https://copilot.microsoft.com/labs](https://copilot.microsoft.com/labs). This experimental feature is designed to test new ways of conversing with AI. You must be 18+ with a verified account to access this experiment. We're starting with a limited group of users in the United States, United Kingdom, and Canada to gather feedback and ensure a high-quality experience before expanding access.

## How many portraits can I choose from?

The experiment currently offers 40+ pre-designed portraits. You can browse through all options to find portraits that feel relatable or appealing to you. Each portrait has a unique visual style and look, but all portraits are powered by the same Copilot intelligence.

## Can I customize the portraits?

You can select from Copilot's existing voice options to match each portrait's vibe. Simply click on the Gear button to access the Voice settings window at the bottom of the portrait. From there, you can select any of the available Copilot voices for your portrait.

## What types of conversations are a good fit for this experiment?

Copilot Portraits is great for creative brainstorming, practicing presentations, deep diving into your interest areas, learning new skills, getting advice, or any time real-time visual feedback helps you get into the flow of conversation.

## Is Copilot Portraits for consumers or enterprise?

This is a consumer-focused experience launching in Copilot Labs.

## What technology is powering this experiment?

This experiment leverages VASA-1, an advanced AI technology developed by Microsoft Research to create real-time, visual AI conversations. The innovation allows us to generate natural facial expressions, head movements, and lip-sync from just a single image - no complex 3D modeling required. This creates the smooth, responsive visual feedback you see when chatting with each portrait. For technical details, check out the [VASA-1 research paper](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/research/project/vasa-1/).

## How does Microsoft ensure this technology is used safely?

Several safety measures are in place.

- All of Copilot's existing safety filters apply (blocking harmful content, hate speech, and more).
- Portraits are intentionally stylized, rather than photorealistic, to avoid confusion with real people.
- Users over the age of 18 only.
- Session and daily time limits to prevent overuse.
- Clear AI disclaimers throughout the experience.
